channel.title: Combat
channel.description:
I know that an Entity based combat system is the way to go, but there is a problem: I have no clue what an enitiy is, or how to use it.
If someone could elaborate on what exactly it is, it would be greatly appriciated. Thanks.

item.title: Combat
item.dc:creator: @relexlawl relexlawl
item.description:
@relexlawl wrote:

It’s just a class that game entities (ground items, game objects, players and npcs) extends off of, it’s not something entirely needed, but is incredibly helpful since now you wouldn’t need more than 1 method that does the same thing, for example getting the entity’s location. Now once you have an entity you can extend even further and have a CharacterEntity class or something along the name and have specific methods that players and npcs would have such as the other entity they are in combat with, etc.

In general, you should just read:

http://www.tutorialspoint.com/java/java_abstraction.htm

Read full topic

item.title: Combat
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

An Entity is anything in the game world. Trees, are entities, players are entities, and Npcs are entities. Now, depending on the server framework, there may be a subclass of Entity that is the superclass of both Players and Npcs (such that Entity > some class > Npc + Player).

Read full topic

item.title: Combat
item.dc:creator: @enzo42 enzo42
item.description:
@enzo42 wrote:

Entity is basicly having one method for both Players vs player, player vs npc, and npc vs npc i believe

Read full topic

I think it’s like all forms of combat use the same method, not sure may be completely wrong
